And he shewed<S>7200</S> me Joshua<S>3091</S> the high<S>1419</S> priest<S>3548</S> standing<S>5975</S> before<S>6440</S> the angel<S>4397</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, and Satan<S>7854</S> standing<S>5975</S> at his right hand<S>3225</S> to resist<S>7853</S> him. <sup>Satan: that is, an adversary</sup> <sup>to: Heb. to be his adversary</sup>
And the LORD<S>3068</S> said<S>559</S> unto Satan<S>7854</S>, The LORD<S>3068</S> rebuke<S>1605</S> thee, O Satan<S>7854</S>; even the LORD<S>3068</S> that hath chosen<S>977</S> Jerusalem<S>3389</S> rebuke<S>1605</S> thee: is not this a brand<S>181</S> plucked<S>5337</S> out of the fire<S>784</S>?
Now Joshua<S>3091</S> was clothed<S>3847</S> with filthy<S>6674</S> garments<S>899</S>, and stood<S>5975</S> before<S>6440</S> the angel<S>4397</S>.
And he answered<S>6030</S> and spake<S>559</S> unto those that stood<S>5975</S> before<S>6440</S> him, saying<S>559</S>, Take away<S>5493</S> the filthy<S>6674</S> garments<S>899</S> from him. And unto him he said<S>559</S>, Behold<S>7200</S>, I have caused thine iniquity<S>5771</S> to pass<S>5674</S> from thee, and I will clothe<S>3847</S> thee with change of raiment<S>4254</S>.
And I said<S>559</S>, Let them set<S>7760</S> a fair<S>2889</S> mitre<S>6797</S> upon his head<S>7218</S>. So they set<S>7760</S> a fair<S>2889</S> mitre<S>6797</S> upon his head<S>7218</S>, and clothed<S>3847</S> him with garments<S>899</S>. And the angel<S>4397</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> stood by<S>5975</S>.
And the angel<S>4397</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> protested<S>5749</S> unto Joshua<S>3091</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>; If thou wilt walk<S>3212</S> in my ways<S>1870</S>, and if thou wilt keep<S>8104</S> my charge<S>4931</S>, then thou shalt also judge<S>1777</S> my house<S>1004</S>, and shalt also keep<S>8104</S> my courts<S>2691</S>, and I will give<S>5414</S> thee places to walk<S>4108</S> among these that stand by<S>5975</S>. <sup>charge: or, ordinance</sup> <sup>places: Heb. walks</sup>
Hear<S>8085</S> now, O Joshua<S>3091</S> the high<S>1419</S> priest<S>3548</S>, thou, and thy fellows<S>7453</S> that sit<S>3427</S> before<S>6440</S> thee: for they are men<S>582</S> wondered at<S>4159</S>: for, behold, I will bring forth<S>935</S> my servant<S>5650</S> the BRANCH<S>6780</S>. <sup>wondered: Heb. of wonder, or, sign</sup>
For behold the stone<S>68</S> that I have laid<S>5414</S> before<S>6440</S> Joshua<S>3091</S>; upon one<S>259</S> stone<S>68</S> shall be seven<S>7651</S> eyes<S>5869</S>: behold, I will engrave<S>6605</S> the graving<S>6603</S> thereof, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, and I will remove<S>4185</S> the iniquity<S>5771</S> of that land<S>776</S> in one<S>259</S> day<S>3117</S>.
In that day<S>3117</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>, shall ye call<S>7121</S> every man<S>376</S> his neighbour<S>7453</S> under the vine<S>1612</S> and under the fig tree<S>8384</S>.
